channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: There's a big Fed inflation reading coming Friday. Here's what to expect
item.description: There could be some pretty good inflation news on the way from the Commerce Department when it releases a key economic report Friday.

item.title: Japanese yen weakens to fresh 38-year lows, crosses 161 against the U.S. dollar
item.description: The last time the currency was at this level was in December 1986.

item.title: Nike shares plunge after retailer says quarterly sales will fall 10%, warns on China weakness
item.description: Nike has found itself in a rough patch as the sneaker giant has worked to claw back market share it's ceded to upstarts like On Running and Hoka.

item.title: Asia-Pacific markets rise as investors assess Japan economic data and await U.S. inflation reading; yen hits fresh 38-year low
item.description: Investors will be keeping an eye on the yen, as well as key inflation and factory data out of Japan.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Roaring Kitty, Nike flops, inflation on deck
item.description: Nike's shares fell 12% after cutting guidance. Roaring Kitty's post caused brief volatility in Chewy's stock. The S&P 500 gained slightly.

item.title: Chinese automakers expected to achieve 33% global market share by 2030
item.description: Chinese automakers are expected to continue rapidly expanding outside of China to achieve 33% of the global automotive market share by 2030.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: The humble onion could be holding India's economy hostage
item.description: Even a modest change in the price of the bulbous vegetable soon becomes the talking point around dinner tables for hundreds of millions of people in the country.

item.title: Trump will debate Biden while still bound by gag orders. Here's what he can't say
item.description: Former President Donald Trump and President Joe Biden are set to debate for the first time in the 2024 presidential cycle, with polls showing a tight race.

item.title: Forget to-do lists. Here are 4 tips on how to stop procrastinating
item.description: In a world that is increasingly distractible, learning how to harness our attention is the "skill of the century," says best-selling author Nir Eyal.

item.title: Onboard forests, street markets and reefs: Disney releases details about its new cruise in Singapore
item.description: The Disney Adventure will sail three- and four-night voyages from Singapore starting in 2025, with the capacity to carry some 6,700 passengers on board.

item.title: JPMorgan Chase says its stress test losses should be higher than what the Fed disclosed
item.description: Last year, Bank of America and Citigroup made similar disclosures, saying that estimates of their own future income differed from the Fed's results.

item.title: In a new round of 'panda diplomacy,' China sends giant bears to the U.S. after two decades
item.description: After 21 years, giant pandas are en route from China to the U.S. â€” a sign that Beijing is resuming its "panda diplomacy" efforts as relations with the West thaw.

item.title: AeroVironment CEO describes how drones are the future of modern warfare
item.description: In a Thursday interview with CNBC's Jim Cramer, AeroVironment CEO Wahid Nawabi discussed his company's drone technology.

item.title: Rivian investor day focuses on cost reductions, efficiencies and next-generation EVs
item.description: Rivian shares fell about 2% to 6% for much of the event on Thursday, eating into their 23% gain the day before on news of an up to $5 billion investment by VW.

item.title: France's upcoming election is rattling nerves and raising debt crisis talk
item.description: "In the worst case there is a fully-fledged bond market and fiscal crisis," one economist said.

item.title: Chewy stock pops 34% after Roaring Kitty posts a dog picture, then gives it all back
item.description: Shares of the online pet food retailer saw a big roundtrip after Roaring Kitty posted a picture on social media platform X resembling its logo.

item.title: â€˜A disastrous eventâ€™: All-out war between Israel and Hezbollah could devastate both sides
item.description: Hezbollah, considered to be among the most heavily armed nonstate groups in the world, is estimated to have 10 times the military capability of Hamas.

item.title: U.S. needs major nuclear power expansion to meet rising electricity demand, Southern Company CEO says
item.description: The U.S. needs to install more than 10 gigawatts of new nuclear power, said Chris Womack.

item.title: Home prices begin to cool as active listings jump 35%
item.description: For the four weeks ended June 23, the typical home sold for slightly less than its asking price, according to real estate brokerage Redfin.

item.title: Sweden's central bank chief says 2 to 3 more rate cuts this year is a 'forecast not a promise'
item.description: Erik ThedÃ©en told CNBC the inflation outlook was more positive, particularly around inflation expectations and wage growth.

item.title: H&M plunges 13% on doubts over full-year margin target, June sales outlook
item.description: Shares of H&M plunged more than 14% Thursday morning after the company reported a smaller-than-expected increase in second quarter profits.

item.title: Walgreens stock plunges as drugstore chain slashes profit guidance in 'challenging' consumer environment
item.description: The results and guidance cut come as Walgreens works to slash costs by closing underperforming U.S. stores, among other measures.

item.title: Crypto catches M&A frenzy as bitcoin miners chase AI boom
item.description: Crypto companies are at the center of a wave of deal-making as bitcoin miners look for ways to use their massive data centers to jump into the world of AI.

item.title: Troops and armored vehicles disperse as Bolivia arrests army chief leading coup attempt
item.description: "The country is today facing an attempted coup d'etat," Bolivian President Luis Arce said, according to a CNBC translation

item.title: Europe wants to send data centers into space â€” study says it's possible
item.description: Europe is exploring the possibility of launching data centers, which consume vast amounts of electricity, into space.

item.title: China sets mid-July for highly anticipated â€˜Third Plenumâ€™ meeting to discuss 'deepening reform'
item.description: China's top leaders will gather from July 15 to 18 for a highly anticipated meeting known as the Third Plenum, state media announced Thursday.

item.title: Caspar Lee says young people are unlikely to make lots of money on YouTube and should do it for fun
item.description: YouTuber turned entrepreneur Caspar Lee says it's difficult to make a "significant living" from YouTube because it's a highly competitive space.

item.title: Inside Europe's tech hubs: France's AI push puts it on the rise
item.description: France has looked to position itself as Europe's leading artificial intelligence hub, with companies like Mistral AI and H getting large amounts of funding.

item.title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang addresses rising competition at shareholder meeting after historic stock surge
item.description: Since last year's meeting, Nvidia has been on a historic run.

item.title: Amazon plans to launch discount store in bid to fend off Temu and Shein
item.description: Amazon's storefront would directly compete with Temu and Shein, two emerging e-commerce sites with ties to China that have grown in popularity in the U.S.
